intro: Arrojadoa eriocaulis subsp. albicoronata, commonly known as the white-capped arrojadoa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, grass-green leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It is typically found in sandy or coastal soils, often in dune environments. This subspecies is notable for its adaptability to coastal conditions and its role in stabilizing dune ecosystems.
